Award.AwardTitle: RAPID: Robots Designed to Assist During Nuclear Catastrophes - Autonomously Creating 3-D Maps, Collecting Radiation/Other Data at Japan's Fukushima Nuclear Plants

Directorate.LongName: Directorate for Computer & Information Science & Engineering

Award.AbstractNarration:
The project advances the state-of-the-art of autonomous Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM) algorithms, and maximizes the ability to explore under extreme conditions with minimal time using real-time 3D methods in nuclear power plants. The integrated system consists of a hardware system with three LIDAR's, a CPU, a GPU, a battery and a wireless unit.

The state-of-the-art in nuclear power plant disaster mitigation is a direct consequence, as well as the development of more advanced and robust SLAM techniques that are applicable in all domains.
